section.title: Introduction to the XML Document Manager Server
section.para: Mobicents XDM is a free and open source implementation of the XML Document Management server as defined in Open Mobile Alliance specifications. This functional element of next-generation IP communications networks is responsible for handling the management of user XML documents stored on the network side, such as presence authorization rules, static presence information, contact and group lists (a.k.a. resource lists), policy data, and many others.

section.title: XDM Server Architecture
section.para: The XML Document Manager Server runs on top of the Mobicents Converged Application Server and is also dependent upon the XCAP (XML Configuration Access Protocol) and SIP resource adapters.
Architecturally, the XDM Server is essentially an XCAP server that employs a SIP interface, which allows the server to learn about document updates.
The XDM Server can also use an element named the Aggregation Proxy, which is responsible for user authentication and result-caching on XCAP requests.
An XDM Server abstracts the element that stores XML documents as a data source.
